newsitem.title: GERMANY: Volkswagen up on 9-mth profit boost.
newsitem.headline: Volkswagen up on 9-mth profit boost.

text.p: Shares in German car maker Volkswagen AG climbed on Wednesday after the firm said its pre-tax profit soared 56.2 percent during the first nine months of the year on strong sales growth.
Group pre-tax profit for the first nine months of 1996 was 1.481 billion marks, up from 948 million marks for the same period last year.

VW stocks ended bourse trade up eight marks, or 1.4 percent, at 587.75 marks, having earlier touched a session high of 591 marks, while the DAX index of 30 leading shares was down 0.72 percent at 2,699.37.

VW said in a statement that group sales climbed 14.2 percent between January and September to a record 74.49 billion marks and that its after-tax profit climbed to 465 million marks from 185 million for the same period in 1995.
